verb.description: Form small creases or wrinkles in the surface of something, especially the skin of the face as the result of a facial expression.
examples: his face crinkled up in a smile
Burney crinkled his eyes in a smile

noun.description: A wrinkle or crease on the surface of something.
examples: there was a crinkle of suspicion on her forehead

origin: Late Middle English: related to Old English crincan (see cringe).
